intro: Rosa × dumetorum subvar. cinerosa, commonly known as the smoky rose, is a perennial shrub native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its dark, almost black stems and leaves that are covered in a fine, grayish down. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a slight bluish tinge. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is often cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
